definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: The device was also probably used to predict solar eclipses and indicate other planetary motions.
sentences.chinese: 這一裝置也有可能被用來預測日食和其他天體活動。

sentences.english: Penumbral lunar Benying and did not sweep the place, simply can not see the solar eclipse.
sentences.chinese: 月球本影和半影沒有掃過的地方，根本看不見日食。

sentences.english: Chinese folk legend, the solar eclipse is "Tengu" caused by swallowing the sun.
sentences.chinese: 中國民間傳說中，日食是“天狗”吞食太陽造成的。

sentences.english: Thus, the Saros is useful for organizing eclipses into families or series.
sentences.chinese: 因此，沙羅週期對將日食排序是相當有用的。

sentences.english: But for others, the eclipse was seen to be a bad omen.
sentences.chinese: 但是對於有些人而言，日食也被視爲不祥之兆。

sentences.english: But in many countries eclipses have traditionally been seen as bad omens.
sentences.chinese: 但在許多國家，日食傳統上被視爲噩兆。

sentences.english: Hundreds of enthusiasts wearing goggles catch a glimpse of the phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 數百位熱情人士戴著護目鏡捕捉日食現象的驚鴻一瞥。

sentences.english: Unlike solar eclipses, lunar eclipsesare safe to watch with the naked eye.
sentences.chinese: 與日食不同，裸眼看月食是安全的。

sentences.english: The time when a solar eclipse will occur can be calculated.
sentences.chinese: 日食發生的時間可以推算出來。

sentences.english: Unlike solar eclipses, lunar eclipses are safe to watch with the naked eye.
sentences.chinese: 與日食不同，裸眼看月食是安全的。

sentences.english: Please do not be panic, because this is a normal astronomic phenomenon on the earth.
sentences.chinese: 遇到日食，請不要驚慌，這只是正常的天文現象。

sentences.english: The solar eclipse, July 21, will open a new chapter of professional growth.
sentences.chinese: 7月21日的日食將會給你的職業成長帶來新的一章。

sentences.english: A man and his camel walk past a solar eclipse in Gaotai, Gansu province in China.
sentences.chinese: 在甘肅高臺，一名男子牽着駱駝走在日食的光暈下。

sentences.english: A solar eclipse happens when the moon swings between the Earth and the sun.
sentences.chinese: 日食時當月球移動到地球和太陽之間時發生的。

sentences.english: The films and plates are put in their holders the night before the eclipse .
sentences.chinese: 膠捲或感光片應在日食前裝入暗盒。

sentences.english: Eclipse is a very intriguing astronomic phenomenon.
sentences.chinese: 日食是非常引人入勝的天文現象。

definition: an annular eclipse of the sun
meteorological or astronomical phenomenon (e.g. rainbow or eclipse)
aspect of the celestial bodies (used for navigation and astrology)
